cyclone.name: ELSA
cyclone.current_location: about 40 mi SSW of Tiburon, Haiti
cyclone.trajectory: Moving WNW, forecast to turn NW across central-western Cuba Monday, then track northward through the eastern Gulf and along/near the U.S. southeast coast toward the Mid-Atlantic late week

weather_observation.watch_coast: Cayman Brac and Little Cayman; Cuban provinces of Matanzas, Mayabeque and Havana; Florida Keys from Craig Key westward to Dry Tortugas
weather_observation.warning_coast: Southern Haiti from Port-au-Prince to the Dominican Republic border; Jamaican coast; many eastern and central Cuban provinces
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Caribbean Islands, Cuba, Florida west coast, U.S. southeast coast from Florida to the Carolinas
weather_observation.wind: Low chance (5%) of tropical-storm-force gusts late next week; otherwise breezy conditions
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected for Delaware River or upper Delaware Bay
weather_observation.rainfall: Potential for 1-3 inches of rain as the weakening system or its remnants pass nearby late week
weather_observation.other_hazards: Minor river or urban flooding possible if heavier rain bands reach the Philadelphia area
